title: Systematic Mathematics Instructional Design Strategies for Enhancing MOOC Design Quality and Analyzing Learner Assessments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (equations, functions, geometry, etc.) and intermediate-level application skills (problem-solving, graph interpretation, etc.)
context.additional_context: A long-term course for current elementary math teachers collaborating with corporate training managers to conduct project-based assessments. Emphasizes alignment with math education standards and practical applicability.

learning_goals: Enhancing the ability to systematically analyze the quality of MOOC mathematics content (such as clarity of formulas and systematicity of problem-solving) by applying ten instructional design principles
Strengthening the capacity to derive improvement points for mathematics education through learner sentiment analysis and apply them to actual lesson design
Developing collaborative, differentiated, and collective knowledge-building learning activities focused on solving mathematical problems (e.g., equation solving, graph interpretation)

Learners produce one MOOC design guideline applicable to real school settings (primary/secondary) through project-based assessment (teams of 4–6 members), meeting the following criteria: 1) verification of integration with three or more mathematics curricula (e.g., equations, geometry, statistics), 2) specification of a five-stage design process (needs analysis → formula derivation → problem structuring → assessment design → feedback incorporation), 3) incorporation of feedback from at least two field teachers

resources: Class Central Top 20 MOOC case database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
